revised_title: Pulse Radiolysis Study of Solvated Electrons and Alkali-Metal-Electron Species in Cyclic Amides
tldr: This article investigates the radiation chemistry of organic amides through pulse radiolysis, focusing on solvated electrons and alkali-metal-electron species in cyclic amides. The study finds that the absorption spectra of solvated electrons are present in cyclic amides, and no new absorptions attributable to alkali-metal anions are detected. The decay of solvated electrons in these amides is also examined, providing insights into their formation and behavior.
